com.digev.fw.log

Class Log

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.digev.fw.log.Log
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Logger

    public abstract class Log
extends java.lang.Object
implements Logger
    Base interface for all log implementations.

      • getLog

        public static Log getLog(java.lang.String name)
        Returns the log implementation for the given name. If none found one will be created.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the log.
        Returns:
        Log implementation for the given name.

      • getLog

        public static Log getLog(java.lang.Class cl)
        Returns the log implementation for the given class. If none found one will be created.
        Parameters:
        cl - Class associated with the log.
        Returns:
        Log implementation for the given class.

      • isDebugEnabled

        public abstract boolean isDebugEnabled()

        Is debug logging currently enabled?

        Call this method to prevent having to perform expensive operations (for example, String concatenation) when the log level is more than debug.

        Specified by:
        isDebugEnabled in interface Logger

      • isErrorEnabled

        public abstract boolean isErrorEnabled()

        isErrorEnabled in interface Logger

      • startTraceBlock

        public void startTraceBlock(long category,
                            java.lang.String blockName)
        Deprecated. Please use startTraceBlock(String)
        Parameters:
        category -
        blockName -

      • startTraceBlock

        public abstract void startTraceBlock(java.lang.String blockName)
        Indicates to the logger that all subsequent messages should be grouped as a block when tracing. Trace blocks can be nested with subsequent calls to startTraceBlock without ending the previous block. CAUTION: Trace blocks consume system resources that can only be released by a endTraceBlock() call. Not calling endTraceBlock() will result in a memory leak.
        Parameters:
        blockName - Name of the trace block.

      • startDetachedTraceBlock

        public abstract void startDetachedTraceBlock(java.lang.String blockName)

      • endTraceBlock

        public abstract void endTraceBlock()
        Ends the current trace block. This method MUST be called for every trace block started to release resources associated with the block or a memory leak will result.

      • getFactory

        protected static LogFactory getFactory()
